block.p: Lisa Britton Parker and Adam Herschell Gorfain, producers at ''Dateline NBC'' in New York, were married yesterday on Nantucket Island. The Rev. James L. Burns, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at Siasconset Union Chapel in Siasconset, Mass.
The bride is an associate producer and the bridegroom a senior producer.

Lisa Britton Parker and Adam Herschell Gorfain, producers at ''Dateline NBC'' in New York, were married yesterday on Nantucket Island. The Rev. James L. Burns, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at Siasconset Union Chapel in Siasconset, Mass.
The bride is an associate producer and the bridegroom a senior producer.

Mrs. Gorfain, 31, graduated from Boston University and received a master's degree in journalism from Stanford. She is the daughter of Diane Parker Coyer of Pasadena, Calif., and the stepdaughter of Robert G. Coyer, a retired structural engineer who worked at C. F. Braun & Company, an engineering concern that was in Alhambra, Calif.

Mr. Gorfain, 35, graduated cum laude from Harvard. He is the son of Judith and Louis Gorfain of Mamaroneck, N.Y. The bridegroom's mother is a product development consultant to the food industry. His father is a founding partner in New Screen Concepts, a television production company in Stamford, Conn.
